location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Camp - Jeypore [Jaipur] to Charles Umpherston Aitchison, Secretary to the Government of India, Foreign Department

mods.abstract: Letter regarding Pundit Munphool's resignation from the ministership of Bikaneer [B카k훮ner], and his request to be considered for the position at Kotah which the Government is considering Fyz Alli Khan [Faiz Ali Khan] for.The letter goes on to discuss recent interference at Puttiala [Patiala]; the ladies in the administration at Dholepore [Dholpur]; Colonel Alexander Ross Elliot Hutchinson's request to be sent on furlough; the possibility of sending Colonel William Carnell to the Oodeypore [Udaipur] Agency for a few months; and regarding confirmation of Pelly's appointment in Rajpootana [R훮jasth훮n].
